qas.question: How far from state house in downtown Boston is Harvard Yard?
How many residential dorms house upper class, sophomore, Jr, and Sr students?
Along what geographic feature are nine residential houses located?
How far from the Yard is the Quad located?

answers.text: half a mile northwest of the Yard

qas.question: How many acres of land is the State House situated on?
What neighborhood is Edward Harkness formerly from?
Who were formerly housed at Sever Hall?

plausible_answers.text: Radcliffe merged its residential system with Harvard

qas.question: Why did Radcliffe College students stop residing at Sever Hall?
Where is the office of Edward Harkness located?

context: Harvard's <b4_0>209-acre (85 ha)<b4_0/> main campus is centered on Harvard Yard in Cambridge, <a0_2>about <a0_0><a0_1>3 miles<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> (5 km) west-northwest of the State House in downtown Boston, and extends into the surrounding <b5_0>Harvard Square<b5_0/> neighborhood. Harvard Yard itself contains the <b8_0>central administrative offices<b8_0/> and main libraries of the university, academic buildings including Sever Hall and University Hall, Memorial Church, and the majority of the freshman dormitories. Sophomore, junior, and senior undergraduates live in <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>twelve<a1_2/><a1_1/> residential Houses<a1_0/>, nine of which are south of Harvard Yard along or near the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>Charles River<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>. The other three are located in a residential neighborhood <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>half a mile<a3_2/><a3_1/> northwest of the Yard<a3_0/> at the Quadrangle (commonly referred to as the Quad), which formerly housed <b6_0>Radcliffe College students<b6_0/> until <b7_0>Radcliffe merged its residential system with Harvard<b7_0/>. Each residential house contains rooms for undergraduates, House masters, and resident tutors, as well as a dining hall and library. The facilities were made possible by a gift from Yale University alumnus Edward Harkness.
